required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CAR-T for Children With Relapsed and Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Uncontrolled, Multicenter Clinical Trial to Explore the Safety, Efficacy, and Remission Phase of Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell (CAR-T) in the Treatment of Children With Relapsed and Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

collaborator.agency: The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, CAR-T will be administered to children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia to explore the effect of CAR-T intervention time on the duration of complete remission and further verify the long-term safety and efficacy of CAR-T treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: After clinician evaluation, if the child meets the study criteria and after adequate communication, the parent or legal guardian voluntarily joins the clinical study, CAR-T technique can be used for related treatment, and the long-term therapeutic effect can be observed. In this trial, 50 children were publicly enrolled and treated with CAR-T. Patients participating in the clinical trial will be tested and assessed in terms of treatment safety, efficacy, and duration of response.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Severe/Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety diagnosis
Copies numbers of CAR in peripheral blood(PB) and/or bone marrow(BM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate of complete remission and partial remission

arm_group.description: The child's parents or legal guardians voluntarily signed the informed consent form, and the child himself/herself met the enter criteria for the diagnosis of patients with acute B-lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL) expressing specific target antigens

intervention.description: CD19 CAR-T infusion for pediatric patients with CD19 positive tumor cells
CD22 CAR-T infusion for pediatric patients with CD22 positive tumor cells
CD19+22 CAR-T infusion for pediatric patients with CD19 positive and CD22 positive tumor cells

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University

facility.name: No.2 Hospital of Hebei Medical University
